title: Amazing.
text: Booked into the hotel on Sunday 27th Sept, we were greeted with a friendly welcome and a glass of Bubbly. The Hotel is beautiful and offers breath taking views of the ocean and lighthouse. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. Amenities and towels are great as well. The staff are magnificent and attend to your every need. The protocols taken by the hotel due to covid restrictions were absolutely brilliant, From upon check in - to the breakfast buffet proper santization is ensured as well as regular temperature checks. This makes guests feel safe yet they can still enjoy all their facilities. The breakfast was scrumptious and a large variety was available. The only negative comment that I have would be that the curtains and balcony need maintainance.

title: This hotel has huge potential.
text:
The staff employed at this Hotel are of excellence in hospitality, we were met by a lovely lady at reception and every staff member that I had an encounter with were thereafter were friendly and met our needs timeously and efficiently. The hotel has a great location and was easily accessible. The rooms had great views of the ocean and surrounding attractions. This hotel has been upgraded recently and although the rooms are really nice and spacious, the towels and linen were clean and good quality, the room amenities are great, the bottles of water were replenished daily and the turn down chocolates were a lovely treat. However the cleanliness is below std. The carpets were not washed or cleaned by upon
arrival nor during the two night stay. The bathroom mat had mould on it. The lounge area were also not wiped or cleaned. The shower water does not drain well and the tub had not been washed. I had addressed these with the house keeping lady however returned to the room exactly the same. The breakfast was plentiful and good.

title: Turned away for being alone.
text: I had visited the Wimpy at Mall of Africa for a quick bite and coffee before attending a meeting, to my disappointment I was turned away from a "normal" table because the waiter had said I was alone. I could understand if the store was busy however there were not many people at the restaurant. Poor service. Wont be back.

title: Little Greece in Jhb
text: This restaurant is fabulous. The decor, the veiw, the host and waiters are friendly making this restaurant a little gem. Authentic Greek food with a modern twist. The food is delicious and abundant so you wont go hungry. The cocktails are a tad expensive however are great anyway. The lamb chops are braai greek style. The yiros and souvlakis are amazing. The hummus could be abit better but still edible non the less. Will be back here time and again.

title: Fantastic
text: PAPPAS is always great. Their service is excellent and food always exceeds expectations. Their prawns are the best in JHB, while the lamb chops are good but could do with a little extra seasoning. The starters are great, the Haloumi with pita and hummus is superb. Thank you for always being consistent, with your hospitality and great standard of food.

title: Poor
text:
We had visited this restaurant to celebrate my grand mother's birthday, what was suppose to be a good evening out turned out quiete the opposite. Although our waiter was really good nothing else was up to std. The food is pre cooked and heated. Tasteless and unappetizing. 3 of our diahes got sent back, the veg palau was burnt, and had to be sent back. The paneer is of low quality, lacked flavour and had excessive salt. This you could see was reheated as it was watery and gross.
The fresh juices were served warm. The Dosa was good but the chutneys were all lacking in flavour. Not worth the money. Find alternative vegetarian options.

title: My weekly hangout
text: The food is always impeccable. Being a usual at this restaurant, the service is always great. The variety of options on the menu cater for vast variety of taste buds. My favorites are the tacos and the pastas. The Ginger Green juice are good for non cheat days. The cakes are simply out of this world, I have two favorites the custard coconut and the bar one cheese cake. Got to have my weekly dose of these.

title: Delicious
text: Sunday afternoon binge session. Their fully loaded chilli cheese fries are Devine. And the Mofo wings.... Well they deffinately Mofo... Good service and friendly waiters.

title: Disgusting food
text: This restaurant came highly recommended by a few friends and I decided to try it out. Ordered a take away of the chicken noodles and some sushi. The sushi was average and the chicken noodles were completely burnt. Waste of time and money. Deffinately not worth the drive there or the money spent.

title: Always Amazing
text: The staff and management are so friendly and welcoming. The service is indredible and quick even though it was really busy. The food is of high quality, freshest ingredients and tasty. We had the haloumi and Greek salad starters, mains were peri peri prawns, the lamb chops, and souvlaki. The cocktails are great as well. The baklava cheese cake is heavenly. A supurb family restaurant. A must try for authentic Greek food. 10/10.

title: Average
text: I have been to this restaurant when it first opened, and I was surprised to have such tasty Greek food in SA on that day the food was a definite 8/10. I have been back a few times since the opening and it looks as if the standard had dropped, the yiros are now dry and bland, and the lamb portions smaller. Disappointing.

title: High Tea
text: It was sensational. The 5 cause paired high tea was so incredible. It was literally 5hours of eating all the wonderful fresh food. The service was excellent we had two waitors Letty and Jerry and they were on the ball. Each course came exactly on time and was paired excellently with the food. The sweet station is 5star such a huge variety of things. Hats off the chefs and staff of the Bistro. It was truly incredible.

title: Impeccable service and excellent view.
text: I had booked for a birthday celebration at Flames restaurant. We were welcomed with such great honor and respect and it was all uphill from there. The food was amazing. The view from our table was incredible. The Champaign was excellent. The service received was beyond expectations. Will deff be back. Highly recommended to anyone celebrating a special occasion.
place: Flames Restaurant at Four Seasons Hotel The Westcliff

title: Something you have to do in Paris.
text: This dinner and show was simply spectacular. The food was excellent, the service impeccable and the show was simply sublime. The cast and their acts were out of this world. Highly recommend seeing a show taking place here. There were even some royalty in attendance If you from South Africa, it is worth every Rand spent.

title: Shoppers Paradise
text: A Shoppers Paradise. The fashion capital street. You may bump into a few celebs while shopping which is an added bonus.

title: The brilliance of art.
text: A must see if you visiting Paris. Fast pass entries and bookings are advised. The home to Mona Lisa, however I expected a bigger painting of her... It is still beautiful though.

title: Takes your breath away everytime.
text: The Eiffel tower adds to the beauty of this City. The 360 panoramic views from the city day or night are simply just breath taking. The view from the top is magnificent and so picturesque you could literally spend hours there just taking in the beauty of Paris. If you visiting the tower, the trip to the top on a fast pass entry is definitely worth the few extra euros as you avoid the really long queues.

title: Just an average meal
text: There was such a hype around this place the first time I visited Paris but I didn't have the time to check them out, so on my next visit this was on my bucket list of things to do. However, I was hugely disappointed, even though they claim to have famous Celebraties dine at their restaurant, their food is average, lacks flavor and the cleanliness is poor. The oily floors and tables are a complete put off. The service is really good though. They get 10 points for that. Not Worth it for me though.

title: Excellent
text: This hotel gets 10/10 scoring, the hotel staff are amazing and really helpful. The rooms are unique and modern with stunning views of the Eiffel tower. They are also spotlessly clean. The breakfast, snacks and drinks provided daily was awesome and a large variety to suit many. Trains, Trams and busses are easily accessible from this hotel and are within walking distance.
place: Okko Hotels Paris Porte de Versailles

title: Excellent
text: This hotel provides the quintessential stay, the rooms are spotlessly clean and spacious with amazing views of Durban. All amenities are provided. The hotel staff are very helpful and are at your service in no time. A wonderful stay. Would deff be back.

title: Excellent food , great service ,value for money
text: I would class this as a hidden gem, great service and excellent food. The kebabs are a must with chillies. Great flavour and value for money. The pizza is one of the best that I had in Rome.

title: Very good
text: We stayed at this hotel on our trip to Italy , Rome. We had booked a 6 night stay and it was lovely. Spotlessly Clean rooms with elegant decor. All the room amenities that one would require are available and replaced daily. The hotel is located central to Roma termini and the city center. There are many bus stations and metro around so it makes it really easy to travel around the city. Breakfast is average ,no variety of options to choose from.

title: Overated,Overpriced, not worth your Rands.
text: The pictures and site reviews sell you aspects that look fantastic ...5star luxury as they claim. This place doesnt even have certification to prove that they 5star. I had requested this and the reception staff could not even provide me with it . The reception area is untidy with a guest toilet that is dirty and stained. They have no reception area aircondioning, the pool is a small splash pool that isnt great for swimming and which isnt the cleanest. The view from the hotel is incredible, the breakfast provided to our room patio and the breakfast staff are fantastic , these aspects gets a solid 8.5/10. The location is perfect within walking distance from the town and bus station. However what grades this place down for me personally, was that the rooms need upgrading, I do understand the authentic greek theme in the rooms,however since they claim 5 star they should provide 5star towels, bed linen, and general room amenities which they do not. The bathroom had abit of mould around the shower. The housekeeping services would not even wash out the cups provided for drinking. Upon check out at 2am the man ( not even worthy of being called a gentleman) at the reception desk was beyond rude to my husband and I, which resulted in a screaming match over a pack of Pringles which we did not even consume. After almost half n hour of arguing we had no appology from him nor a reply from the hotel regarding his rachet behaviour. Is that how they treat guests?! There is no "5star" hotel in the world that would treat people the way they do. My advise, there are proper 5star rated hotels in Santorini you would get value for money elsewhere.

title: Delicious with Value for money
text: We Tried out Lucky's based on TripAdvisor reviews and this place did not disappoint. Delicious food at an affordable price. We tried the falafel and chicken souvlaki and both were really tasty. I rate this the best one on the Island. The service was great and the owner very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend Lucky's to those visiting Santorini.

title: Really Good
text: Tried Oblelix out on our first day in Santorini , and it was really good. They use a chilli sprinkle which is really gives it a great flavour. The ingredients are fresh and the food is really tasty. The service is exceptional considering how small and busy they get. The vibe is really cool too, so grab a few food options to try , a few beers and enjoy.

title: Spectacular views and sunsets
text: The view is magnificent and the sunset is incredible from this restaurant. However the waiters are unfriendly. Stumbled upon this place while taking a walk through the town, the amazing view is what captured the attention so we decided on going there for drinks and dessert, the cocktails are good whilst the baklava is terrible. Dry and old . (Actually back home in South Africa we get much better baklava than the ones made in Greece). The views make up for this though....

title: Awesome food, Awesome view, Great service
text: Greeted with friendly smiles and a warm hospitality. This restaurant offers indoor , outdoor beach terrace and beach bed seating. Their service is really up to mark even though they were busy. The food was delicious and plentiful. The cocktail was good too. Highly recommend this restaurant if you visiting the beautiful Perrisa beach.

title: Excellent. Superb staff.
text: This hotel is modern and elegant. We were welcomed by friendly staff that assisted us with any request that we had during our stay. It is spotless clean and comfortable. The mini-bar is replenished daily. The breakfast has a large variety of options and was really good. The best part of this hotel was it offered a free cellphone to make calls and use of internet services. I recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Athens.

title: Tasty Food
text: Traditional Greek restaurant. Variety of options on the menu. The Souvlaki and gyro's were really good and flavourfull. Well priced and good atmosphere.

title: Average
text: The souvlaki and Gyro were average compared to the other places we have eaten at. The Greek salad however was the highlight, it was fantastic, fresh and delicious. Service was not that grand. Outside area quite comfortable with fans to keep cool during the hot summer days.

title: Great food
text: Great Food with value for money. Freshest ingredients and really tasty. Best we have had in Athens. Service could be a little bit better but non the less food is awesome.

title: Spectacular
text: Its a great way to learn about Greek History. It is as beautiful as you see it in magazines and news papers. Be prepared to wait for a min of 2hours if you do not not have a fast track entry ticket. This is quite daunting in the blistering sun never the less worth it in the end.

title: Horrible and unappetizing
text: I had seen Krinos bakery on a tv show and it was on a bucket list of things to eat while in Athens. Disappointing. These donuts were cold and oily and the sauce lumpy . Not worth the walk or Euros you have to pay for them.

title: Great Tasting Gelato
text: Really Good flavoured Gelato. The waffles are good as well. Raspberry Sorbet is the best. Well priced and friendly staff.

title: Beautiful
text: Its beautiful however the construction and scaffolding around it makes it look like just another building.

title: Picturesque little town
text: Its beautiful. The walkways and views of the Acropolis are stunning especially at night. There are hidden gem taverns and gelato shops that are great tasting and value for money. Also great jewellery shops with really pretty pieces however they do rip of tourists with prices so shop around before settling on one shop.

title: Terrible. Dirty. Unfriendly
text: Would not recommend this hotel for people whom are predantic about cleanliness. The rooms smell mouldy and damp. The couches smell terrible and were wet upon check in. The bedsheets do not fit properly. The bathrooms are in terrible condition. There is mould and grime on tiles and shower. The taps are broken. Towels do not get changed and the cups and glasses do not get washed. The telephone did not work and there was black tape around the door to hold up the electronic disc. Not to mention certain staff are really rude and unfriendly. How does Sun International allow this?
